concept.title: Position Dimension Text Vertically
concept.shortdesc: The vertical text placement is the position of the text relative to the dimension. You can place text above, below, or centered within the dimension line, or use the JIS dimensions.

conbody.p: Above places dimension text above the dimension line; Outside places dimension text on the side far from the point you specify for the dimension line; Centered places dimension text medially within the dimension line; JIS places dimension text according to the Japan industry standard.

In the ANSI standards, centered dimension text splits the dimension line. In the ISO standards, centered text places above or outside the dimension line. In the following illustrations, ISO standards allow angular dimension text to display in any of the ways shown.

The justification and other settings may affect the vertical alignment of text. If you select Horizontal Alignment, text inside the extension lines and centered within the dimension is placed horizonta ly, as shown in the leftmost figure above.
